gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਗੁਪਾਲ ਰਿਸਯੰ ਅਸੁਰੰ || ਬਿਨੁ ਮੋਹਿ ਸੁ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਭਜੋ ਦੁਸਰੰ ||
transliteration: Soun(i) Naam(u) Goupaal Risyan Asuran|| Bin(u) Moh(i) Su Kaoun(u) Bhajo Dousran||
translation: On hearing the Name of Lord-God, the demon became furious and said, “Who else is there except me on whom you are meditating?”

gurmukhi: ਜੀਯ ਮਾਹਿ ਧਰੋ ਸਿਸ ਯਾਹਿ ਹਨੋ || ਜੜ੍ਹ ਕਿੳੁਂ ਭਗਵਾਨ ਕੋ ਨਾਮ ਭਨੋ ||੬||
transliteration: Jeeyo Maah(i) Ddaro Sis Yaah(i) Hano|| Jadh Kioun Bhagvaan Ko Naam Bhano||6||
translation: He decided to kill this student and said, “O fool; why are you repeating the name of Lord-God?”6.

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਅੳੁਰ ਥਲੰ ੲਿਕ ਬੀਰ ਮਨੰ || ੲਿਹ ਕਾਹਿ ਗੁਪਾਲ ਕੋ ਨਾਮੁ ਭਣੰ ||
transliteration: Jal Aur Thalan Ik Beer Manan|| Eh Kaahe Goupaal Ko Nam(u) Bhanan||
translation: “Only Hiranayakashipu is considered the mithty-one in water and on land , then why are you repeating the name of Lord-God”?

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਹੀ ਤਿੱਹ ਬਾਂਧਤ ਥੰਮ ਭੲੇ || ਸੁਨ ਸ੍ਵਨਨ ਦਾਨਵ ਬੈਨ ਧੲੇ ||੭||
transliteration: Tab Hitihh Baandhat Thanm Bhaaa|| Soun Sravnan Daanav Bain Dhae||7||
translation: Then, as commanded by the king, the demons tied him with the column.7.

gurmukhi: ਗਹਿ ਮੂੜ ਚਲੇ ਸਿਸ ਮਾਰਨ ਕੋਂ || ਨਿਕਸਯੋਬ ਗੁਪਾਲ ੳੁਬਾਰਨ ਕੋਂ ||
transliteration: Gad(i) Moond Chale Sis Maaran Kon|| Niksyoh Goupaal Oubaaran Kon||
translation: When those foolish persons advanced to kill this student, the Lord manifested Himself at the same time in order to protect His disciple.

gurmukhi: ਚਕਚੳੁਪ ਰਹੇ ਜਨੁ ਦੇਖ ਸਭੈ || ਨਿਕਸਯੋ ਹਰਿ ਫਾਰਿ ਕਿਵਾਰ ਜਬੈ ||੮||
transliteration: Chakchaudh Rahe Jan(u) Dekh Sabhai|| Niksyo Har(i) Pdaar(i) Kivaar Jabai||8||
translation: Al those who saw the Lord at that time were astonished, the Lord had manifested Himself by tearing off the doors.8

gurmukhi: ਲਖਿ ਦੇਵ ਦਿਵਾਰ ਸਭੈ ਥਹਰੇ || ਅਵਿਲੋਕ ਚਰਾਚਰ ਹੂਹਿ ਹਿਰੇ ||
transliteration: Lakh(i) Dev Divaar Sabhai Thahre|| Avilok Chraachar Hooh(i) Hire||
translation: Seeing Him, all the gods and demons trembled and all the animate and inanimate objects became fearful in their bearts;

gurmukhi: ਗਰਜੇ ਨਰਸਿੰਘ ਨਰਾਂਤ ਕਰੰ || ਦ੍ਰਿਗ ਰੱਤ ਕੀੲੇ ਮੁਖ ਸ੍ਰੌਣ ਭਰੰ ||੯||
transliteration: Gadje Narsingh Naraant Karan|| Drig Ratt Keee Moukh Sraoun Bharan||9||
translation: The Lord in the form of Narsingh (man-lion), with red eyes and the mouth filled with blood, thundered dreadfully.9.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਦਾਨਵ ਭਾਜ ਚਲੇ ਸਭ ਹੀ || ਗਰਜਯੋ ਨਰਸਿੰਘ ਰਣੰ ਜਬ ਹੀ ||
transliteration: Lakh Daanav Bhaaj Chale Sabh Hee|| Gadjyo Narsingh Ranan Jab Hee||
translation: Seeing this and hearing the thunder of Narsingh all the demons fled;
